revision.text: ==English== ===Etymology=== Borrowed from {{bor|en|ja|山城|tr=Yamashiro}}. ===Proper noun=== {{en-proper noun|Yamashiros}} # {{surname|en|from=Japanese}}. ===Statistics=== * According to the 2010 United States Census, ''Yamashiro'' is the 24608<sup>th</sup> most common surname in the United States, belonging to 1015 individuals. ''Yamashiro'' is most common among Asian/Pacific Islander (76.35%) and Multi-racial (12.22%) individuals. ---- ==Japanese== ===Romanization=== {{ja-romaji}} # {{ja-romanization of|やましろ}} ---- ==Portuguese== ===Etymology=== Borrowed from {{bor|pt|ja|山城|tr=Yamashiro}}. ===Proper noun=== {{pt-proper noun|m|g2=f}} # {{surname|pt|from=Japanese}} ---- ==Tagalog== ===Etymology=== Borrowed from [[Hepburn]] [[romaji]] of {{bor|tl|ja|山城|tr=Yamashiro}}. ===Proper noun=== {{tl-proper noun}} # {{surname|tl|from=Japanese}}
